title: @Lonewingy, Evelynn's hands trigger my arachnophobia and I think that's awesome
body:
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/DKN80QPXUAAIv--.jpg

Have you noticed how spidery her hands are?

This arts is genius because it builds on seemingly conflicting primal emotions to convey the character's personality. Looking at it, I feel attraction towards the near-naked succubus, existential dread at the withered face of her victim and a very mundane, yet uncanny fear towards the way her hands are painted, like a pair of spiders standing above their prey.  

I love the way the art plays on the ideas we associate with these three concepts to subtly express all the design work and ideas Eve's team has been building for months.

Riot just keeps getting better.

replies.body:
Notice the fact that she has a pair of extra pointy teeth? 

HINT HINT.

She looks more red and pale in terms of colors too......along with that kinda drained looking head it makes you wonder. 

We got some huge mixup of things here.

Well, in the legends of succubi, repeated encounters with one lead to deterioration and death.

The "huge mix up" is probably intentional. Each little bit of information is a part of her character; while retaining the mysterious nature she has.

That much is true.

But ya know....there is another group of .....monsters? That has a penchant for draining people dry.

And they have pair of pointy teeth, often described to be pale as corpses.

Ringing any bells yet?^^

Politicians you mean?

{{sticker:vlad-salute}}
As someone coming from a country where politicians are despised your on to something
There are countries where they _aren't_ despised?
North Korea likes their leader very much :)
Yeah but that's because propaganda makes them look good.
No. That's because if you don't like Kim Jong-un and make your opinion public, you and your family end up in a concentration camp.

What, you think Kim Jong-un ISN'T despised? Or do you think North Korea ISN'T propagandized all to hell?

Because either way you're wrong :P

You completely misunderstood my comment.

NK people ARE FORCED to publicly manifest their agreement towards Kim, otherwise they and their family are brought to concentration camps.

You completely misunderstood MINE.

This convo is about nations where politicians aren't despised. North Korea's people either despise their government (in which case NK doesn't count) or believe the propaganda (as I said).
It's more like, you and your family, and your family's family, and your friends, and your coworkers, and that guy that sold you a coffee.

Hey lying is like half of what she does.

to be more precise that was really really long ago that the legends succubi acting like that, and rarely did it result in death, most often it was just deteriorated health or mental state.

The strong emphasis on "death because of sex/interaction with" didn't come till much later when succubi were made to be corporeal instead of ethereal/dream invaders and was more developed because of story/novel writers instead of people actually believing these demons existed

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosThief,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=vhuEjrK9,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-09-21T17:12:05.776+0000)
>
> Well, in the legends of succubi, repeated encounters with one lead to deterioration and death.
> 
> The "huge mix up" is probably intentional. Each little bit of information is a part of her character; while retaining the mysterious nature she has.

Odd part is, the notion of the "spirit spouse" or a spirit that has intercourse with corporeal humans appears in a lot of mythology all around the world. Usually in association with a shaman or some similar kind of role.  Western civilization though only inherited the more negative and frightening mythology from Mesopotamia. What I think would be interesting would be if in the future, is if a champ was released that was some kind of Support.
Shes not a vampire, succubus maybe, vampire never.

I dunno, she has the teeth and color scheme going for her, and the way the dead guy looks drained is very vampire-ish looking too. 

Her back is very reminiscent of elise's human form too though, and some spiders have been known to suck their victims bodies dry of fluids. 

A lot of things going on there.

"The strands of destiny weave only a web of death."

I love Anub'arak  in Heroes of the Storm, and playing scourge in my Warcraft 3 days.

http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/100/670/Nope20110725-22047-kmp4zf.png

Very good job for sure!

But now I have the question, is Eve still a shadow isles character or did she deviate?

Considering her color scheme, if she is associated with the SI, she might be in a similar position as Elise.

But, I would find it more likely that she's independent, and has become a special entity in the same vein as Kindred and Bard.
I still think she's going to be a demon. And we know demons are created by human emotions and stuff, so its possible Eve was created by the suffering caused by the Ruination.
OK I see Rioters are blending in well with their crowd of memekids. :/ *sigh*

I don't know why people are complaining saying they ruined her visuals. She looks way better than before and still looks really similiar to old eve, just new colors. People also like to talk down on her even though we know nothing about her new lore if there is any, just be patient dudes this rework is looking warwick level so far!

Full VGUs usually include a lore update (Galio, Poppy, Urgot, etc), thought since Eve already has a decent enough color story, I imagine hers will be an expansion rather than a major change. At least, I hope so. I like Eve as this wandering ultra-skilled assassin who demands more from her clients than simple cash. If she's also a demon who enjoys causing pain (see Vayne's lore) that's even better. It implies she does this work because she enjoys it.

The black stuff covering her reminds me of the black mist of the shadow isles, so it's very possible she was once human and corrupted into what she is now by the mist. If they keep her association with the isles (which they should, imo) I'm curious to see what she thinks of, say, Yorick or Elise.

{{champion:28}} to {{champion:60}}  : The difference between you and me? They know I'm dangerous, but they come just the same~
to {{champion:83}} : A gentleman would give a lady his cloak.
to {{champion:82}} : I always find a way to the heart. Even if you literally don't have one.

And now I'm thinking of other champs because I'm bored.
to {{champion:268}} : An Emperor? Nah, I already got too many.
to {{champion:164}} : Screw business. This one's personal... (after a kill) "I'm back on top."
to {{champion:4}} : ... actually, you look familiar. Did I dump you?
to {{champion:35}} : ... You I like.
to {{champion:67}} : Oh, my~ I've missed you, my little masterpiece...
to {{champion:56}} : "Darkness"? You're funny.
to {{champion:6}}  : Mmmmm... So much pain...

I could see Eve being something that was trapped in Thresh's vault and got out when the Ruination occurred. Maybe she even had a part in causing it, as we know the magical artifacts of the vault fueled the Ruined King's spell.

I can tell her passive will make the mist just wrap around her fully when she goes camo. It'll look so fucking amazing if it has VFX like that. I also agree about how it looks like mist and I hope she gets more iterated into being shadow isles instead of just being someone from there with no affiliation of it. I like this new shadow isle theme more with yorick and eve, they look like they belong there now instead of it just being dead or scary looking = from shadow isle.
